Civil Litigation.question: The total number of Justices of the Court of Appeal is:
Civil Litigation.reason: Section 237(2)(b) CFRN provides for not less than 49 Justices. However, it may be increased by an Act of the National Assembly. Thus, section 2 of the Court of Appeal Act 2013 provides for a total of 90 Justices

Civil Litigation.question: The Constitutional composition of the Supreme Court is:

options.a: The CJN and such number of Justices as may be determined by the NJC
options.b: The CJN and such number of Justices as may be determined by the President
options.c: The CJN and such number of Justices not less than 21
options.d: The CJN and such number of Justices not exceeding 21

Civil Litigation.answer: The CJN and such number of Justices not exceeding 21
Civil Litigation.reason: Section 230(2)(a)(b) CFRN provides for The CJN and such number of Justices not exceeding 21.

Civil Litigation.question: The monetary jurisdiction of the Small Claims Court in terms of a counter-claim is the maximum amount of:
Civil Litigation.reason: The monetary jurisdiction of the Small Claims Court in terms of a counter-claim is the maximum amount of #10,000,000

Civil Litigation.question: Alteration or change of parties is necessary in all the following instances except:
Civil Litigation.reason: Alteration or substitution of name of parties is usually in cases of death and bankruptcy. order 13 rule 30 High Court civi procedure Rules Abuja 2018

Civil Litigation.question: The mode of applying for leave to bring a representative action is:
Civil Litigation.reason: This is actually a matter of practice. The 2004 rules expressly stated that it should be by motion ex parte but such provision was omitted in the current rules. Failure to seek leave to file such will not invalidate the suit

Civil Litigation.question: Where there is a failure to join a party who ought to be joined in a proceeding before the Court, the effect is that:

options.b: A procedural irregularity which won't lead to striking out the case
options.c: The case will be struck out
options.d: The case will be declared non-suit

Civil Litigation.answer: A procedural irregularity which won't lead to striking out the case
Civil Litigation.reason: see Order 15 rule 16(1) Lagos and Order 13 rule 16(1) Abuja

Civil Litigation.question: Under the Magistrate Court Law of Lagos 2009, the following grades of Magistrate Courts exist in Lagos
Civil Litigation.reason: By virtue of section 93 of the Magistrate`s law of Lagos state 2009, there are no more grades of magistrate`s

Civil Litigation.question: Assuming judgment was given against the claimant in an Interlocutory matter and he wishes to appeal, within how many days after delivery of judgment must it be done?
Civil Litigation.reason: Article 14(1) of the Practice Direction of SCC.

Civil Litigation.question: Service of originating process can be done by any but one of the following:
Civil Litigation.reason: Order 7 rule 1 Abuja Rules 2018 provides that: service of an originating process shall be made by a sheriff, Deputy sheriff, Bailiff, Special Marshal or other officer of the court

Civil Litigation.question: The appropraite way of presenting facts to the court in an action commenced by originating summon is?
Civil Litigation.reason: Where an action is commenced by originating summons, the facts are presented by affidavit evidence, unlike statement of claim, where an action is commenced by writ of summons. Order 2, Rule 3(5), Abuja.

Civil Litigation.question: Where no rules/laws are cited in a motion, the Court can still grant the motion if:

options.a: It was filed within a reasonable time
options.b: There is a rule/law that empowers the court to grant it
options.c: The other lawyer has no opposition

Civil Litigation.answer: There is a rule/law that empowers the court to grant it
Civil Litigation.reason: As long as there exist a law/rule that actually empowers the court to grant that prayer, then even if a false law was used, it will not invalidate and would be regarded as a mere irregularity

Civil Litigation.question: A motion Exparte generally terminates after?

options.c: Pending the determination of the suit

Civil Litigation.reason: A motion ex parte is used for urgent matters and is accompanied by a motion on notice in injunctions

Civil Litigation.question: How is an interpleader application commenced in Abuja?
Civil Litigation.reason: Order 48 rule 5 Abuja Rules 2018 says that the applicant will use a summon.

Civil Litigation.question: When a suit on the undefended list comes to the court for the first time, it is for:
Civil Litigation.reason: When a suit on the undefended list comes to the court for the first time, it is for hearing. Order 35 Abuja rules 2018

Civil Litigation.question: Assuming at the trial of a case, if the only witness of the claimant has refused to attend court to tender a document that is vital to the case, the witness’ attendance can be compelled by:

options.c: Subpoena ad testificandum et duces tecum

Civil Litigation.reason: Since the witness is coming to Court to tender a document, subpoena duces tecum is what is appropriate.

Civil Litigation.question: Which of the following is true of the evidence of a child who has not attained the age of 14 years?

options.a: The child can only give an unsworn evidence
options.b: The child can give both sworn and unsworn evidence
options.c: The child can only give sworn evidence
options.d: The child is capable of giving sworn evidence but can decide not to on ground of religion

Civil Litigation.answer: The child can only give an unsworn evidence
Civil Litigation.reason: see Section 209(1), Evidence Act

Civil Litigation.question: which of the following is not a public document?

options.b: Certificate of title issued by the land Registry

Civil Litigation.reason: section 102 of the Evidence Act provides for what constitutes public documents

Civil Litigation.question: A hostile witness is one who?

options.a: has refused to speak in court
options.b: has been a witness for the adverse party before in another case
options.c: has refused to speak the truth
options.d: has said things detrimental to your case

Civil Litigation.answer: has refused to speak the truth
Civil Litigation.reason: A hostile witness is defined as one who has refused to tell the truth. see Esan v. State

Civil Litigation.question: A written address must be filed within how many days of close of evidence
Civil Litigation.reason: see Order 33 Rule 13 Lagos, Order 32 Rule 14 Abuja.

Civil Litigation.question: How many days must judgment be delivered in an Election petition
Civil Litigation.reason: see. Section 285(6) CFRN, ANPP v. Goni

Civil Litigation.question: If all the parties to a civil action in the course of proceedings seek an adjoumment to settle their dispute out of court, they wil need to file and adopt in court:
Civil Litigation.reason: The parties file and adopt terms of settlement and the court gives out their terms of settlement as consent judgment

Civil Litigation.question: The best means to recover possession from a tenant against whom the court has made an order of recovery of possession is:
Civil Litigation.reason: The court issues a warrant of possession after 14 days from the date the judgement was delivered except judgement stipulates otherwise.

Civil Litigation.question: Which of the following best describe the mode to be adopted to commence Fundamental rights action?
Civil Litigation.reason: Originating motion/application is used to commence a Fundamental rights action especially when the matter is contentious (see  Minister of Internal Affairs v. Shugaba). It is however possible to use originating summons where the matter is not contentious and you only want a provision to be interpreted (see Doherty v. Doherty)

Civil Litigation.question: The three cross-examination techniques are?
Civil Litigation.reason: They are the 3 techniques for cross examination one can employ when cross examining a witness. Confrontation involves bringing out facts that contradicts what the witness says; Probing involves asking more questions on a shaky area to show inconsistency

Civil Litigation.question: One of the following shall constitute an agenda for the Case Management Conference as stated under the Rules:

options.a: Adoption of witness statement on oath.
options.b: Control and scheduling of discovery, inspection and production of documents.
options.c: Media coverage of the case management proceedings
options.d: Registration of the judgment of the case management judge.

Civil Litigation.answer: Control and scheduling of discovery, inspection and production of documents.
Civil Litigation.reason: Order 27 of both HCCPR Abuja and Lagos provide for the matters in the pre-trial conference and case management conference respectively

Civil Litigation.question: What are the processes that you need to file to commence the case management conference

options.a: Case management notice and case management information sheet
options.b: Statement of defence, affidavit in support, witness statement on oath and list of witnesses.
options.c: Writ of summons, motion on notice and supporting affidavit
options.d: Case managerment certificate and verifying affidavit

Civil Litigation.answer: Case management notice and case management information sheet
Civil Litigation.reason: Order 27 rule 10(1) HCCPR Abuja, order 27 rule 1 HCCPR Lagos. The claimant shall apply for pre-trial notice/ case management notice within 7 days of close of pleading in Abuja / within 14 days of close of pleadings in Lagos

Civil Litigation.question: The purpose of examination-in-chief is to:

options.a: Lead the witness to give evidence as to the swearing to his affidavit before the court
options.b: Lead the witness to adopt his witness statement on oath
options.c: Lead the witness to give evidence as to the swearing to his witness statement on oath before the court.
options.d: Lead the witness to identify his witness statement on oath

Civil Litigation.answer: Lead the witness to adopt his witness statement on oath
Civil Litigation.reason: Thanks to the frontloading concept, examination in chief has been reduced to simply leading the witness to adopt his statement on oath as all the material facts are already contained there.

Civil Litigation.question: Before the examination-in-chief, the witness would have been

options.a: Sworn or affirmed by the judge
options.c: Sworn or affirmed by the Registrar

Civil Litigation.answer: Sworn or affirmed by the Registrar
Civil Litigation.reason: This is the part where the witness will swear or affirm to tell the truth, the whole truth and nothing but the truth. it is done by the Registrar

Civil Litigation.question: Appeals of the Magistrate Court must be filled within how many days of the decision of the Magistrate Court?
Civil Litigation.reason: Appeals of the decision of the Magistrates to the High Court must be made within 30 days of the decision.

Civil Litigation.question: Assuming a cause of action involves arbitrary imposition of electricity bills and it is impracticable to obtain the consent of all affected, what will be the appropriate action?
Civil Litigation.reason: Class action is used when the parties can not be ascertained and if ascertained cannot be found or if found, the action would be proper to use same. see Order 13 rule 15 HCCPR Abuja 2018

Civil Litigation.question: Where the suit borders on the interpretation of the will of the deceased, the appropriate mode of commencing the action will be by?
Civil Litigation.reason: Interpretation of documents or statute should be by Originating summons.

Civil Litigation.question: Where the defendant has been served with the writ in Abuja, they are expected to file defence within how many days?
Civil Litigation.reason: In Abuja, Pleadings (statement of defence) is to be filled within 21 days while Apperance is to be entered within 14 days. In lagos, its 42 days for both Apperance and pleadings.

Civil Litigation.question: At the end of the trial, the defendant will address the court first:

options.b: If the defendant did not adduce evidence.
options.d: If the claimant does not adduce evidence

Civil Litigation.reason: Whoever gives evidence last will address the court. It will fall on the claimant if the defendant does not adduce evidence

Civil Litigation.question: Assuming the claimant and his Counsel were absent on the date fixed for case management conference, which of following steps can properly be taken by the court?

options.b: Dismissal of the action of the claimant.
options.d: Stay further proceedings in the matter until the claimant Comes to court.

Civil Litigation.answer: Dismissal of the action of the claimant.
Civil Litigation.reason: The court can dismiss the action of the claimant when he is in default of attending the Case management conference

Civil Litigation.question: What is the mode of commencing an action under the undefended list procedure
Civil Litigation.reason: You commence it with a writ of summons accompanied with an affidavit and a pre-action counselling certificate. see Order 35 HCCPR FCT

Civil Litigation.question: Assuming Ibe is a yearly tenant in Madam Sade's 3 Bedrooms flat at 3, Kando Street Apapa. Lagos and she wants to recover possession of the property from him, she must do one of the following to properly recover possession:

options.a: Issue her with a 6months' notice to quit to expire on the eve of the anniversary of her tenancy.
options.b: Issue her with a 6 months' notice to quit to expire any time during or after the expiration of her tenancy.
options.c: Issue her with a 3months' notice to quit to expire on the anniversary of her tenancy.
options.d: Issue her with a 7 days' notice of owner's intention to apply to, recover possession

Civil Litigation.answer: Issue her with a 6months' notice to quit to expire on the eve of the anniversary of her tenancy.
Civil Litigation.reason: Since he is a yearly tenant, she is to issue a 6 months notice to quit to expire on the eve of the anniversary of his tenancy

Civil Litigation.question: The monetary jurisdiction of the district court is
Civil Litigation.reason: The monetary jurisdiction of district court is 7million

Civil Litigation.question: Will the magistrate court have jurisdiction where the arrears of rent exceeds 10 million but the annual rental value is below 10million
Civil Litigation.reason: The magistrate court can have jurisdiction even where the arrears of rent exceeds 10 million but provided the Annual rental value is below 10million

Civil Litigation.question: A party who intends to challenge a fact in an affidavit is to file:
Civil Litigation.reason: Counter claim and statement of defence are both pleadings

Civil Litigation.question: The case that emphasised the need for the written authority of the landlord before a solicitor can proceed to recover premises from the tenant is?
Civil Litigation.reason: in Coker v. Adetayo, the court of Appeal held that both notices (notice to quit and owner's intention to recover possession) must only be issued with the written authority of the landlord.
